conclusion: Analyze the flow path of the liquid from each inlet (A, B, C, and D) through the baffles.
Inlet A (Blue): The liquid flows downward and encounters the first baffle (red).
Liquid from Inlet A will be directed towards the right.
Inlet B (Light Blue): The liquid flows downward and encounters the second baffle (purple).
Liquid from Inlet B will be directed towards the right.
Inlet C (Yellow): The liquid flows downward and encounters the third baffle (pink).
Liquid from Inlet C will be directed towards the right.
Inlet D (Orange): The liquid flows downward and encounters the fourth baffle (black).
Liquid from Inlet D will be directed towards the right.
All liquids from inlets A, B, C, and D are directed towards the right after passing through their respective baffles.
Container E (Blue): Located on the left side.
Container F (Yellow): Located on the right side.
Since all liquids are directed towards the right after passing through the baffles, they will flow into Container F.
The liquid from inlets A, B, C, and D will flow into Container F after passing through the baffles.
